title: Kanye West has finally released his 'Jesus Is King' album after many delays
text:
CLOSE Swift described in detail how she attempted to reconnect with West in 2015, after his infamous onstage crashing of her Video Music Awards speech in 2009. USA TODAY

Prayers from Kanye West's fans have finally been answered.

West released his highly anticipated (and highly delayed) "Jesus Is King" album Friday, four weeks after his ninth studio album was originally scheduled to drop.

It was a long, bumpy road to release. The rapper's wife, Kim Kardashian West, first teased the gospel-themed album on social media in late August, revealing a handwritten track list and a Sept. 27 release date.

But that day came and went without any new music from Kanye.

Instead, West began teasing the album with fan events.The rapper followed his wildly popular Sunday Service concert at Detroit's Aretha Franklin Amphitheater on Sept. 27, his would-be album release day, with a pop-up listening party for a couple thousand zealous fans hours later.

The rest of the world just had to wait, with Kardashian West instructing the masses to "have faith,", sharing a revamped track list via Twitter. On her Instagram Story, she added, "He's dropping the album Sunday. Just a few final tweaks to the mixes."

More: Kanye West's 'Jesus is King' documentary release date announced, album expected Sunday

But, no. Much like the original Friday release date, no new music awaited fans who logged on Sept. 29.

Instead, West held another star-studded Sunday Service concert that day at the Greater Allen A.M.E. Cathedral of New York in Queens and previewed new songs at a listening party that evening in Manhattan.

Swizz Beatz, Kim Kardashian West, Saint West, North West, Marvet Britto, Kanye West, Jonathan Cheban, Victory Boyd, and Consequence attend Sunday Service at The Greater Allen A.M.E. Cathedral of New York on Sept. 29 in New York City. (Photo: Johnny Nunez, WireImage)

Daughter North, 6, and son Saint, 3, stole the show with their praise dancing.

"So last night during Kanye's screening North & Saint decided to stand in front of the screen and do some dance moves," Kardashian West captioned videos of the kiddos dancing on her Instagram Story.

The power couple didn't announce a new release date for "Jesus Is King."

Kanye West and son Saint at his Sunday Service concert at The Greater Allen A.M.E. Cathedral of New York on Sept. 29. (Photo: Johnny Nunez, WireImage)

His fans were less than thrilled. "kanye after lying about 2 albums in 2 years" read one tweet, accompanied by a snippet of video of West sprinting away from the cameras.

"How Kanye is sleeping knowing he didn't release Jesus Is King," read another, attached to a photo of West sleeping soundly on a couch.

West pulled a similar stunt last year, teasing the release of a project titled "Yandhi" for Black Friday 2018 before failing to drop an album that day and announcing several months later that it had been delayed indefinitely. In the end, nothing came of it.

But momentum began to rev up again this week. On Sunday, the rapper tweeted a promise his album would drop on Friday. And on Wednesday in Los Angeles, West played the entire record at the Forum – transforming the concert hall into a wetland marsh – and screened his companion IMAX film (out Oct. 25), directed by British filmmaker Nick Knight, for the first time.

By Thursday, 'Ye was finally ready. At least fans thought.

"'JESUS IS KING' Midnight" he declared on Twitter, one of his first tweets since New Year's Day.

Then, midnight came and went without a new Kanye album. He tweeted again, thanking fans for their loyalty and patience.

"To my fans Thank you for being loyal & patient We are specifically fixing mixes on 'Everything We Need' 'Follow God' & 'Water' We not going to sleep until this album is out!' he posted.

To my fans



Thank you for being loyal & patient



We are specifically fixing mixes on “Everything We Need” “Follow God” & “Water”



We not going to sleep until this album is out! — ye (@kanyewest) October 25, 2019

Hours later, the record finally descended onto streaming platforms from the (digital) heavens.

Contributing: Maeve McDermott, Brian McCollum, Detroit Free Press, Andrea Mandell

description: Prayers from Kanye West's fans have been answered as the rapper released his highly anticipated (and very delayed) "Jesus Is King" album Friday.
